results.title: Claycraft at Denby
results.brief_description: The Denby Potteries were founded in 1809. This film shot at these Potteries, covers the manufacture from start to finish of English kitchenware (teapots, casserole dishes, etc), ending with a tour of the Potteries’ new showrooms, where the articles displayed show the modern trend of design in everyday ware.
results.description: The Denby Potteries were founded in 1809. results.title: Clay: or the origin of the species
results.creator_credit: Eliot Noyes, Contemporary Films and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description: An art film in which three-dimensional forms of modelling clay are used to express a visual and amusing variation on a theory of evolution as suggested by the simple lifeforms which emerge from graphic motions of a clay sea. Best Film, 6th Annual Annecy film festival.
results.title_for_label: Clay: or the origin of the species

results.title: Clay in action
results.brief_description: Step-by-step demonstrations of a sculptor modelling a head in clay. Shows how he packs clay on wooden supports; the first rough carving; measuring the model with calipers and cutting the measurements into the clay, carving out the larger primary, carving out minor planes; using the thumbs to blend, model and smooth; finishing.

results.title: Clay and water
results.brief_description: In the republic of Mali, in West Africa, traditional architecture is perfectly adapted to climatic conditions and local resources. Houses, monuments and mosques built of clay and earth - some of which have stood for centuries - correspond to the needs of the inhabitants, and show the creative use of materials given to them by nature.

results.title: Claus Bury, landscape sculpture
results.creator_credit: Crafts Resource Productions, David Corke and Crafts Council of Australia
results.brief_description: This film shows Claus Bury, a German sculptor and jeweller, working with Australian tertiary sculpture students in workshop situations. The film looks in particular at his work in outdoor environments. Music by Geoffrey d’Ombrain and camera and editing by David Corke

results.title: Classroom organisation (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Ian Lewis and Drake Educational Associates
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Mathematics in the Infant/First School”.
The point is made that there is no one way to organise a lesson and the teacher in this tape doesn’t always organise her work in the way shown. However viewers will see the basis of her planning and the thought which has gone into her planning of the mathematics class

results.title: Classroom crisis: dealing with violence in school (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Bruce Johnson, Dave Bell Associates and Dave Bell
results.brief_description: Violence presents a real danger for teachers. Dr. Fred Feitler of Youngstown State University has developed strategies for dealing with student fights, physical assaults, disciplinary confrontations and other crisis situations.

results.title: Classifying: juggling shapes, sizes, colors and textures

results.title: Classifying plants and animals
results.brief_description: A short history of classification, introducing Linnaeus’ system of binomial nomenclature. Animation is used to show how Linnaeus’ system works. The classification of the common dog is traced.

results.title: Classifying by computer
results.brief_description: Explains how statistical treatment of survey data and construction of a classification can be done by a suitably programmed computer. Takes us step by step thorugh the process from collection of data, through programming, to final results.
